I hope my colleagues join me in this fight, described by the @EWG as "one of the most pressing public health threats in the United States." 

RT this thread if you want #PFAS chemicals out of your water supply and polluters to pay.

As the Chairman of the @OversightDems Subcommittee on Environment and a member of the bipartisan PFAS Task Force, I am committed to addressing PFAS chemicals and their horrific effects on the American people. 

Enough is enough.

Manufacturers have KNOWN that these chemicals are extremely hazardous to human health and actively tried to HIDE the evidence. My bill will require these companies to pay into a fund which will be used to provide grants to the communities and water systems that are suffering.

The Trump administration's response to this public health crisis? Weakening environmental standards and refusing to hold the companies polluting our water accountable.

The absence of leadership from the President and his @EPA on this issue is stunning. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/25/us/epa-chemical-standards-water.htmlÂ â€¦

Fire-fighting foam is primarily used on military bases - which puts our service members, their families, and surrounding communities at the greatest risk. 

Also at risk - citizens living near civilian airports, like my constituents in #CA48. https://www.cbsnews.com/news/drinking-water-may-contain-pfas-chemicals-in-43-states-according-to-new-study-by-environmental-working-group/Â â€¦

PFAS chemicals are man-made toxins found in every-day items like Teflon, food-wrappers, and fire-fighting foam. 

PFAS exposure can cause: 

ðŸ”¹Cancer
ðŸ”¹Decreased fertility 
ðŸ”¹Birth defects

THREAD: Communities across the United States have been drinking PFAS contaminated water for DECADES. 

I just introduced H.R. 2570, the PFAS User Fee Act of 2019, to protect Americans from these toxic chemicals and hold polluters accountable. 

So, what are #PFAS chemicals?
